msg: Climb to the mattresses and you'll begin. Seek beneath the changing wind.
If you'd like to have some, it's easy to please. Think of this stuff as just juvenile cheese.
In a house, during school, where we sat as a pair, is a clue within view of your fuzzy soft chair.
Winding pathways, dead-end trips. A book of labyrinthes filled with this.
A woodland spirit, giant, sweet. This clue is where you'd find his feet.
The second clue: 'First of October.' Now, go look in the mailbox.
There's only eight, so just you wait. The last clue's under a fancy plate.
You did it, you made it. You're here at the end. When Lillian's finished, the solving begins!
